summary: I almost wonder why people are surprised or angry that William Gibson dissed that Cyberpunk 2077 trailer. I mean, he and lot of...
body:
I almost wonder why people are surprised or angry that William Gibson dissed that Cyberpunk 2077 trailer. I mean, he and lot of the 80′s era cyberpunk authors moved away from that genre decades ago because it no longer seemed relevant or timely anymore. Most of them were never really into the term to begin with. William Gibson hasn’t written cyberpunk since the 90′s. And part of that is because the genre was based around the concerns and aesthetics of the era, and while modern cyberpunk is certainly different than classic cyberpunk, it still clings to certain aesthetics and cliches that were dated by 1994, let alone 2018. 

I mean don’t get me wrong, if you’ve followed me for any decent length of time then you know I like the 80′s neon-drenched sci-fi aesthetic. I have a tag called America 20XX. And I think you can do cool things with that look and style. But it’s a kind of retrofuturism now. Cyberpunk is a nearly 40-year-old genre. And it’s not really surprising that Gibson wouldn’t be into the fact that there are still folks hitching their claim to a term and an aesthetic that he left back in the 20th century. 

EDIT: And just saying, the game could be great, I’m still interested in seeing how it turns out. I’m just not surprised Old Bill Gibson wouldn’t dig it and don’t hold it against him like some folks seem to.

trail.content:
I almost wonder why people are surprised or angry that William Gibson dissed that Cyberpunk 2077 trailer. I mean, he and lot of the 80′s era cyberpunk authors moved away from that genre decades ago because it no longer seemed relevant or timely anymore. Most of them were never really into the term to begin with. William Gibson hasn’t written cyberpunk since the 90′s. And part of that is because the genre was based around the concerns and aesthetics of the era, and while modern cyberpunk is certainly different than classic cyberpunk, it still clings to certain aesthetics and cliches that were dated by 1994, let alone 2018. 

I mean don’t get me wrong, if you’ve followed me for any decent length of time then you know I like the 80′s neon-drenched sci-fi aesthetic. I have a tag called America 20XX. And I think you can do cool things with that look and style. But it’s a kind of retrofuturism now. Cyberpunk is a nearly 40-year-old genre. And it’s not really surprising that Gibson wouldn’t be into the fact that there are still folks hitching their claim to a term and an aesthetic that he left back in the 20th century. 

EDIT: And just saying, the game could be great, I’m still interested in seeing how it turns out. I’m just not surprised Old Bill Gibson wouldn’t dig it and don’t hold it against him like some folks seem to.

summary: Cyberpunk 2077 | Official E3 2018 trailer From Cyberpunk 2077, “Watch the E3 trailer for Cyberpunk 2077 — the role-playing game...
caption:
Cyberpunk 2077 | Official E3 2018 trailer

From Cyberpunk 2077, “Watch the E3 trailer for Cyberpunk 2077 — the role-playing game of the dark future from CD PROJEKT RED, creators of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.

Cyberpunk 2077 is a narrative-driven, open world RPG set in the most vibrant and dangerous metropolis of the future — Night City. You play as V, a hired gun on the rise, who just got their first serious contract. In a world of cyberenhanced street warriors, tech-savvy netrunners and corporate life-hackers, today is your first step to becoming an urban legend.”

Peace, JW

summary:
I need more gaming blogs to follow 💕
so reblog, boost, like if you post games, i'll check your blog
Cyberpunk 2077
Dragon...
body:
I need more gaming blogs to follow 💕

so reblog, boost, like if you post games, i’ll check your blog

  • Cyberpunk 2077
  • Dragon age
  • Sims
  • Witcher
  • Dishonored
  • Horizon zero dawn
  • Skyrim
  • The last of us
  • Or anything else (no detroit become human, there’s too much of it already 🤫)

Also big plusses are art and astrology

I only follow if you have a tagging system
